solution_line_template: The second year, she quadrupled the number of statues in her front lawn, adding to the original {initial_statues} and bringing the total number to {initial_statues}*{quadrupled_factor}=<<{initial_statues}*{quadrupled_factor}={statues_after_second_year}>>{statues_after_second_year} statues.
In the third year, she added another {added_third_year} statues, bringing the total number to {statues_after_second_year}+{added_third_year}={statues_before_broken} statues.

But a hail storm broke {broken_statues}, reducing the number to {statues_before_broken}-{broken_statues}=<<{statues_before_broken}-{broken_statues}={statues_after_broken}>>{statues_after_broken} statues.

In the fourth year, she added twice as many new statues as had been broken the year before, adding {twice_factor}*{broken_statues}=<<{twice_factor}*{broken_statues}={added_fourth_year}>>{added_fourth_year} statues.

Thus, the addition of these {added_fourth_year} statues brought the total number of statues to {statues_after_broken}+{added_fourth_year}=<<{statues_after_broken}+{added_fourth_year}={final_statues}>>{final_statues} statues.
